conclusion: The problem involves a conductor rod rotating in a magnetic field, requiring calculation of power of external force.
Calculate the induced emf in the loop as ε = ω B π r².
Calculate the current in the loop as I = ε/R = (ω B π r²)/R.
Calculate the power of the external force doing work as P = I² R = (ω B π r²/R)² R = 1/2 ω² B² π r⁴.
The power of the external force doing work is 1/2 ω² B² π r⁴.
